1.heading: Fel-Sarma.
1.title: "Planet of No Return" p. 18-25 in Outer States
1.author: Enki Bilal (New York : Catalan Communications, 1990).
notes: Summary: Fel-Sarma 2 is on his way to see Earth for the first time, when he's forced to land on a planet from which three expeditions, including that of his own father, have failed to return. He hears a noise approaching, and returns to his ship to find it has become tiny. Actually he has grown larger, as he figures out when the approaching sound turns out to be Fel-Sarma 1 out for a walk. The giant Fel-Sarma 1 steps on his son and kills him without noticing.

3.heading: Felch, Sparrow.
3.title: "A Good Night to Go Out to a Movie"
3.author: [No author]
3.series: Our Boarding House with Major Hoople, Dec. 14, 1956
notes: Summary: Ace Brannigan and Sparrow Felch are at the door, having been invited to a fish fry, and it's a surprise for Martha, but she lets them in. Amos isn't home.

4.heading: Felch, Sparrow.
4.title: "Which is Worse, the Reward or the Busted Spring"
4.author: [No author]
4.series: Our Boarding House with Major Hoople, Dec. 15, 1956
notes: Summary: Buster came home last night and found two of Amos's friends (Sparrow and Ace) in his bed; as a reward for sleeping on the couch Buster is offered breakfast in bed.

Request for a book of CJ interviews.

26.heading: Feldman, Ray.
26.title: Doug's Big Comeback
26.author: created by Jim Jinkins ; adapted by Nancy E
26.appears_in: Krulik ; illustrated by Peter List, Cheng-li Chan, Tony Curanaj, Chris Dechert, Brian Donnelly, Ray Feldman, Chris Palesty, Matt Peters, and Jonathan Royce.
notes: (Disney Chapters)
"Jumbo Pictures."

Summary: Doug has always been the target of Roger's taunts, until lately he learned to put down Roger, and everyone is laughing. But now Doug just can't stop being Mr. Funny Guy at the expense of his friends' feelings, until he realizes the comeback remark isn't always as funny as it seems.

27.heading: Feldman, Rosa.
27.title: "Fifth Story" p. 77-96 in Joe's Bar
27.author: Muñoz, Sampayo ; translated by Jeff Lisle ; edited by Bernd Metz.
notes: Summary: Mike Weiss, age 16, falls in love with Rosa Feldman, and she leads him into a sexual relationship. Mike's father is dying of cancer. Mike becomes distraught and gains a lot of weight. Rosa can't advise him, so he avoids her. Mike puts his father out of his pain by throwing him out of the hospital window.
